page.title: 17U.F.O.
page.content: An account in the Matlock Mercury tells how a Matlock family endured weeks of terror as their remote home was plagued by a mystery-shrouded U.F.O. This claim is made in a book called "The Visitation"published by a London publishing group. It describes how the family's encounter with the unknown first began in 1981 as they were travelling on the A632 towards Matlock. They saw a "brilliant ovoid" which began to chase them and finally landed near a disused quarry near Blakelow Hill. The distraught family phoned the Police to be met by a sceptical reaction. The account goes on to tell of the family's mounting fear over the following weeks as the U.F.O. appears regularly, and believing that they alone had been singled out decided to begin a new life elsewhere in Britain.
